vague_description: Finding an optimal investment strategy that balances industry-specific constraints and potential profits is challenging.
detailed_description: Mr. Roberts wants to invest in the telecom and healthcare industries. He has \var{TotalInvestment} to invest. He has decided that the amount invested in telecom be at least \var{MinTelecomRatio} times as much as the amount invested in healthcare. But the money invested in telecom must be at most \var{MaxTelecomInvestment}. If investments in telecom earn \var{ProfitTelecom} and investments in healthcare earn \var{ProfitHealthcare}, how much should Mr. Roberts invest in each to maximize profit?
target_objective: Maximize Mr. Roberts' profit from investing in telecom and healthcare
target_constraints: The investment in telecom must be non-negative
The investment in healthcare must be non-negative
The total investment does not exceed TotalInvestment
The investment in telecom must be at least MinTelecomRatio times the investment in healthcare
The investment in telecom must not exceed MaxTelecomInvestment
target_parameters: Total amount of money Mr. Roberts has for investment
Maximum amount that can be invested in telecom
Minimum ratio of investment in telecom compared to healthcare
Profit rate for the telecom investment
Profit rate for the healthcare investment
